pr_title: Convert discovery-* from integTest to [yaml | java]RestTest or internalClusterTest

timeline.bodyText: This seems like one step forward and one step back. I assume this is also just to appease our testing conventions stuff? If so I feel like this should not be a failure.
timeline.author: mark-vieira
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,9 +90,10 @@ task createKey(type: LoggedExec) {
     '-keypass', 'keypass',
     '-storepass', 'keypass'
 }
-
+//no unit tests
+test.enabled = false

replies.bodyText: yup.  However, it is a bit more rare to have no unit tests (at least until i start converting the qa projects).  For this one we will probably want to toggle the enable/disable the test task if the directory exists or not. I can look into that for a follow up PR.
replies.author: jakelandis

replies.bodyText: Yeah, we are going to have this all over the place for the qa projects that contain only rest tests.
replies.author: mark-vieira

timeline.bodyText: This should really be dependsOn project.sourceSets.yamlRestTest.runtimeClasspath. Just compileYamlRestTestJava doesn't include a) processing resources or b) upstream runtime dependencies so we risk a race condition here.
timeline.author: mark-vieira
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -66,19 +65,26 @@ integTest.enabled = false
  */
 ['KeyStore', 'EnvVariables', 'SystemProperties', 'ContainerCredentials', 'InstanceProfile'].forEach { action ->
   AntFixture fixture = tasks.create(name: "ec2Fixture${action}", type: AntFixture) {
-    dependsOn compileTestJava
-    env 'CLASSPATH', "${-> project.sourceSets.test.runtimeClasspath.asPath}"
+    dependsOn compileYamlRestTestJava

timeline.bodyText: Same as above, we should depending on the source set runtime classpath here, not just the compile task.
timeline.author: mark-vieira
